com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.exception

Class ThrowableUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.exception.ThrowableUtils

  • @NotFullyTested
public final class ThrowableUtils
extends Object
    Static methods for Throwables.
    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

    • Method Detail

      • hashCode

        @NotFullyTested
public static int hashCode(Throwable t)
        Calculates the hash code of any throwable, including null. Stack trace is included in the calculation, which may give surprising results. (It is harder than most realise to create two exceptions with the exact same stack trace.) To exclude stack trace in the calculation, see hashCodeExcludingStackTrace(Throwable).
        Parameters:
        t - any throwable reference, including null
        Returns:
        if input is null, then 0 (zero), else the hash code, including the stack trace.
        See Also:
        hashCodeExcludingStackTrace(Throwable)

      • hashCodeExcludingStackTrace

        @NotFullyTested
public static int hashCodeExcludingStackTrace(Throwable t)
        Calculates the hash code of any throwable, including null. Stack trace is not included in the calculation. To include stack trace in the calculation, see hashCode(Throwable).
        Parameters:
        t - any throwable reference, including null
        Returns:
        if input is null, then 0 (zero), else the hash code, not including the stack trace.
        See Also:
        hashCodeExcludingStackTrace(Throwable)

      • equals

        @NotFullyTested
public static boolean equals(Throwable t1,
                            Throwable t2)
        Compare two Throwable references for equality. Inputs of null (none, one, or both) are handled correctly. Stack trace is included in the comparison, which may give surprising results. (It is harder than most realise to create two exceptions with the exact same stack trace.) To exclude stack trace in the comparison, see equalsExcludingStackTrace(Throwable, Throwable).
        Parameters:
        t1 - first Throwable for comparison
        t2 - second Throwable for comparison
        Returns:
        true if the two Throwable references are equal, including stack traces. If both input references are null, the result is also true.

      • equalsExcludingStackTrace

        @NotFullyTested
public static boolean equalsExcludingStackTrace(Throwable t1,
                                               Throwable t2)
        Compare two Throwable references for equality. Inputs of null (none, one, or both) are handled correctly. Stack trace is not included in the comparison. To include stack trace in the comparison, see equals(Throwable, Throwable).
        Parameters:
        t1 - first Throwable for comparison
        t2 - second Throwable for comparison
        Returns:
        true if the two Throwable references are equal, excluding stack traces. If both input references are null, the result is also true.

      • toString

        @NotFullyTested
public static String toString(Throwable t)
        Creates a descriptive string useful for debugging from a Throwable reference. Causes are fully recursed via Throwable.getCause().
        Parameters:
        t - non-null Throwable reference
        Returns:
        string to describe the Throwable reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if t is null
